elements.contents: public class Card { public enum Suits { SPADE, CLUB, DIAMOND, HEART } public enum Ranks { Ace, DEUCE, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, SIX, SEVEN, EIGHT, NINE, TEN, JACK, QUEEN, KING } public Ranks rank; public Suits suit; public Card(Card.Ranks rank,Card.Suits suit) { this.rank=rank; this.suit=suit; } }

units.rawText: public class Card { public enum Suits { } public enum Ranks { } public Ranks rank; public Suits suit; public Card(Card.Ranks rank,Card.Suits suit) { this.rank=rank; this.suit=suit; } }

elements.contents: import java.util.*; public class Deck { public ArrayList<Card> cards; private Card card; public Deck() { for(Card.Suits s: Card.Suits.values()) { for(Card.Ranks r:Card.Ranks.values()) { card=new Card(r,s); cards.add(card); } } } }

units.rawText: import java.util.*; public class Deck { public ArrayList<Card> cards; private Card card; public Deck() { for(Card.Suits s: Card.Suits.values()) { for(Card.Ranks r:Card.Ranks.values()) { card=new Card(r,s); cards.add(card); } } } }

elements.contents: public class DisplayCards { public static void main(String [] args) { Deck d=new Deck(); for( Card c: d.cards) { System.out.println("Rank of the Card:"+c.rank.toString()); System.out.println("Suit of the Card:"+c.suit.toString()); } } }

units.rawText: public class DisplayCards { public static void main(String [] args) { Deck d=new Deck(); for( Card c: d.cards) { System.out.println("Rank of the Card:"+c.rank.toString()); System.out.println("Suit of the Card:"+c.suit.toString()); } } }

node.contents: public ArrayList<Card> cards; is never initialized, use public ArrayList<Card> cards = new ArrayList<Card>();
